page.title: 05ECOLOGY FARMING GOVERNMENT
page.content: With the decline in the walking from one place to another, traditional public right of way footpaths are being less used. They are in danger of being forgotten and lost - by falling into disuse. People are setting out to record, and walk them, to continue the "right of way". As hedges are being torn out, rights of way which ran along them are now in the middle of huge fields. Many are being "ploughed out". Others are obstructed by farmers who wish them to fall into disuse because they are too difficult to traverse. Other farmers preserve them and assist walkers. Jokes are made about rights of way through country houses.
